UPH METHODIST AND UPH PROCTOR ARE IN THE THIRD YEAR OF AN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN TO ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY NEEDS IDENTIFIED IN THE LOCAL ASSESSMENT THAT WAS DONE IN 2013. A COPY OF THE PLAN IS ATTACHED IN 10B. A STEERING COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF MEMBERS FROM THE THREE LOCAL HOSPITALS, COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE THREE COUNTIES IN THE PRIMARY SERVICE AREA, AND REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS COLLEGE OF MEDICINE AT PEORIA, THE HEART OF ILLINOIS UNITED WAY, AND THE HEARTLAND COMMUNITY HEALTH CLINIC IDENTIFIED EIGHT CRITICAL HEALTH RELATED ISSUES THAT NEEDED ADDRESSED:- ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE- RISKY BEHAVIORS- ASTHMA- DIABETES- HEALTHY BEHAVIORS- LUNG CANCER- MENTAL HEALTH- OBESITYUPH - METHODIST AND UPH - PROCTOR CHOSE TO DEPLOY RESOURCES TO ADDRESS ALL EIGHT ISSUES. BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL AND MANPOWER SUPPORT AND THROUGH UNITYPOINT CLINICS, THE IN-SCHOOL HEALTH PROGRAM, THE WELLMOBILE, THE HULT EDUCATION CENTER AND OTHER RESOURCES, THE TWO HOSPITALS HAVE IMPROVED THE HEALTH AND LIVES OF AREA RESIDENTS. A SUMMARY OF THE EFFORTS BEING MADE IS PROVIDED BELOW:ACCESS:PRIMARY CARE, DENTAL CARE AND COUNSELING SERVICES WERE IDENTIFIED AS ACCESS ISSUES. THROUGH THE DEPLOYMENT OF THE RESOURCES LISTED, ACCESS WAS EXPANDED IN ALL THREE AREAS. FOR EXAMPLE, ED DENTAL VISITS DECLINED FROM 1,380 IN 2012 TO 1,281 IN 2014. RISKY BEHAVIORS:TO ADDRESS RISKY BEHAVIORS, UPH - METHODIST AND UPH - PROCTOR IDENTIFIED A GOAL OF DECREASING THE RATE OF ADULT SMOKING BY 1% AND EDUCATING YOUTH ON THE DANGERS OF ALCOHOL, TOBACCO, AND DRUG USE. A SMOKER REGISTRY WAS DEVELOPED IN THE UNITYPOINT CLINICS ALONG WITH CESSATION PROGRAMS AND HEALTH INSURANCE INCENTIVES FOR PLAN PARTICIPANTS THAT ARE NON-SMOKERS. THE KIDS KONNECTED PROGRAM OFFERS EDUCATION ON THE DANGERS OF TOBACCO AND DRUG USAGE AND PSYCHOSOCIAL COUNSELING IS OFFERED TO YOUTH THROUGH IN-SCHOOL HEALTH AT NO COST.ASTHMA:OUR IN-SCHOOL HEALTH COLLABORATED WITH THE LOCAL PEORIA SCHOOL DISTRICT TO PROVIDE ASTHMA EDUCATION TO STUDENTS AND FAMILIES TO HELP IMPROVE ADHERENCE TO TREATMENT PROTOCOLS AND HELP WITH EARLY IDENTIFICATION AND DIAGNOSIS OF ASTHMATIC CHILDREN.DIABETES:MANAGEMENT OF ADULT AND CHILDHOOD DIABETES IS BEING ADDRESSED WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DIABETIC REGISTRY IN THE UNITYPOINT CLINICS AND THROUGH EDUCATION PROGRAMS OFFERED THROUGH THE DIABETIC CENTER AND HULT. HGBA1C MEASURES ARE TRACKED FOR AT-RISK PATIENTS AND LIFESTYLE COACHING AND NUTRITION EDUCATION ARE PROVIDED.HEALTHY BEHAVIORS:EXERCISE AND DIET WERE IDENTIFIED AS HEALTHY BEHAVIORS THAT NEEDED IMPROVEMENT. COACHING IS PROVIDED FOR AT RISK PATIENTS THROUGH THE UNITYPOINT CLINICS AND THE IMPORTANCE OF EXERCISE AND GOOD NUTRITION IS EMPHASIZED THROUGH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR YOUTH THROUGH IN-SCHOOL HEALTH AND THROUGH HULT.LUNG CANCER:BOTH LOW COST AND FREE SCREENINGS ARE OFFERED TO HELP EARLY DIAGNOSE LUNG CANCER AND DECREASE LUNG CANCER MORTALITY. OVER 80 STAGE I LUNG CANCER CASES HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED SINCE THE PROGRAM BEGAN THAT MAY HAVE OTHERWISE GONE UNDETECTED.MENTAL HEALTH:ACCESS TO GOOD MENTAL HEALTH CARE IS AN ISSUE IN THE SERVICE AREA. 25% OF AREA RESIDENTS SURVEYED IDENTIFIED THAT THEY EXPERIENCED POOR MENTAL HEALTH BETWEEN 1 AND 7 DAYS EACH MONTH. UPH COLLABORATED WITH THE FAYETTE COMPANIES AND UICOMP TO REDUCE ACUTE CARE UTILIZATION FOR BEHAVIORAL DISORDERS THROUGH IMPROVED ACCESS TO COMMUNITY-BASED MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS AND THROUGH PRIMARY CARE SCREENING FOR DEPRESSION. THIRTY DAY READMISSION RATES FOR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DIAGNOSIS HAVE DECREASED FROM 13.6% IN 2012 TO 12.8% IN 2015.OBESITY:OBESITY IN THE AREA POPULATION IS SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN THE ILLINOIS AVERAGE. ILLINOIS, HOWEVER, HAS THE 6TH HIGHEST OBESITY RATE IN THE U.S. OBESITY IS LINKED TO MANY CHRONIC DISEASES INCLUDING DIABETES, HYPERTENSION, HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE AND ORTHOPEDIC PROBLEMS. UPH METHODIST AND UPH PROCTOR SET OUT TO REDUCE THE INCIDENCE OF OBESITY AMONG UNITYPOINT CLINIC PATIENTS AND UNITYPOINT HEALTH METHODIST | PROCTOR EMPLOYEES THROUGH CLINIC EDUCATION, HEALTH PLAN PREMIUM INCENTIVES AND FREE LIFESTYLE COACHING AND COUNSELING FOR AT RISK PATIENTS. THE GOAL WAS TO ASSURE THAT 95% OF ALL UPC PATIENTS HAD A CURRENT BMI RECORDED SO THAT PROGRESS TOWARD WEIGHT LOSS COULD BE MONITORED. 98.7% OF ALL UPC PATIENTS HAVE A BMI DOCUMENTED WITHIN THE LAST YEAR.MORE DETAIL IS AVAILABLE IN THE CURRENT CHNA IMPLEMENTATION PLAN DOCUMENT ATTACHED IN 10B. A NEW COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT WILL BE CONDUCTED IN 2016.

ExplntnTxt: ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL CONVENED A COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL TO CONDUCT ITS COMPREHENSIVE CHNA. THIS COUNCIL WAS CHAIRED BY THE HOSPITAL'S VICE PRESIDENT OF MISSION AND SPIRITUAL CARE AND WAS COMPRISED OF HOSPITAL REPRESENTATIVES FROM BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY RELATIONS, VOLUNTEER SERVICES, PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND MARKETING, ONCOLOGY SERVICES AND RESPIRATORY CARE. ADDITIONALLY, COMMUNITY MEMBERS PARTICIPATED ON THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL, INCLUDING REPRESENTATIVES FROM AUNT MARTHA'S COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER, A FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER (FQHC) AND FAITH LEADERS WHO ARE ALSO MEMBERS OF SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL'S GOVERNING COUNCIL. THE TITLES AND AFFILIATIONS OF THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL'S MEMBERS ARE PROVIDED BELOW. ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL MEMBERS * DIRECTOR, NURSING, AUNT MARTHA'S COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER, HAZEL CREST CAMPUS * DIRECTOR, COMMUNITY RELATIONS, AUNT MARTHA'S COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER * ASSOCIATE PASTOR, COVENANT UNITED CHURCH OF CHRIST - SOUTH HOLLAND/MEMBER, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL GOVERNING COUNCIL * LAY FAITH LEADER, PILGRIM FAITH UNITED CHURCH OF CHRIST - OAK LAWN/MEMBER, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL GOVERNING COUNCIL * INTERN, GOVERNORS STATE UNIVERSITY * VP, MISSION AND SPIRITUAL CARE, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL * VP, BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL * COMMUNITY RELATIONS COORDINATOR, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL * MANAGER, VOLUNTEER SERVICES, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL * BREAST HEALTH SPECIALIST, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL * MANAGER, RESPIRATORY CARE, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL THROUGH KEY INFORMANT INTERVIEWS, THE HOSPITAL ALSO CONSULTED WITH FQHC LEADERS, SCHOOL NURSES, PARISH NURSES AND FAITH LEADERS WITHIN THE PRIMARY SERVICE AREA (PSA). MUCH OF THE EXTERNAL QUANTITATIVE DATA WAS SUPPLIED BY THE COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (CCDPH), ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (IDPH) AND UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN - COUNTY HEALTH RANKINGS. ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER'S CHNA AND MCLEAN COUNTY'S CHP ARE VERY CLOSELY ALIGNED AND THIS SYNERGY RESULTS IN HAVING MORE COLLECTIVE IMPACT IN ADDRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS. USING BOTH PRIMARY AND SECONDARY COMMUNITY HEALTH DATA, THE TEAM IDENTIFIED THE TOTAL SERVICE AREA'S KEY HEALTH NEEDS AND THEN EMPLOYED A PRIORITY-SETTING PROCESS TO DETERMINE KEY HEALTH NEEDS ON WHICH TO FOCUS. STAFF MEMBERS AT ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER, LOCATED 30 MINUTES SOUTHEAST OF EUREKA IN NORMAL, WERE ALSO A PART OF THE HOSPITAL'S CHNA TEAM. BOTH HOSPITALS FALL UNDER THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE SAME PRESIDENT. THE PRIMARY METHOD OF OBTAINING INPUT WAS THROUGH MEETINGS. ExplntnTxt: ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL'S CHNA WAS CONDUCTED WITH THE FOLLOWING OTHER HOSPITAL FACILITIES: - ADVOCATE CONDELL MEDICAL CENTER, LIBERTYVILLE, IL (THROUGH THE LAKE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT) - CENTEGRA HEALTH SYSTEMS, MCHENRY, IL - LOVELL FEDERAL HEALTHCARE CENTER, NORTH CHICAGO, IL (THROUGH THE LAKE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT) - NORTHWESTERN LAKE FOREST HOSPITAL, LAKE FOREST, IL (THROUGH THE LAKE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT) - VISTA HEALTH SYSTEMS, WAUKEGAN, IL (THROUGH THE LAKE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT) ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER'S CHNA WAS CONDUCTED WITH ADVOCATE EUREKA HOSPITAL IN EUREKA, IL. ADVOCATE EUREKA HOSPITAL'S CHNA WAS CONDUCTED WITH ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER IN NORMAL, IL PART V, SEC B, LINE 6B N/A PART V, SEC B, LINE 7D ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER THE LINK FOR THE CHNA REPORT WAS EMAILED TO ADVOCATE BROMENN AND ADVOCATE EUREKA HOSPITALS' DELEGATE CHURCH ASSOCIATION MEMBERS WHO REPRESENT 80 CHURCHES. NUMEROUS COPIES OF THE REPORT AND THE LINK FOR THE REPORT HAVE ALSO BEEN DISTRIBUTED TO THE MCLEAN COUNTY COMMUNITY HEALTH ADVISORY COMMITTEE, THE ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL, AND OTHER APPROPRIATE COMMUNITY PARTNERS, SUCH AS THE DIRECTOR OF THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CARE CLINIC. ADVOCATE EUREKA HOSPITAL THE LINK FOR THE CHNA REPORT WAS EMAILED TO ADVOCATE BROMENN MEDICAL CENTER'S AND ADVOCATE EUREKA HOSPITAL'S DELEGATE CHURCH ASSOCIATION MEMBERS, WHICH IS COMPRISED OF 80 CHURCHES. A COPY OF THE REPORT WAS ALSO GIVEN TO THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE WOODFORD COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT. PART V, SEC B, LINE 11 ADVOCATE CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER HEALTH NEEDS SELECTED TO ADDRESS THREE NEEDS WERE SELECTED AS KEY AREAS OF FOCUS, INCLUDING: 1) CHILDHOOD OBESITY; 2) VIOLENCE REDUCTION; AND 3) ACCESS TO PEDIATRIC PRIMARY MEDICAL CARE FOR LOW INCOME, UNINSURED/UNDER-INSURED, AT-RISK CHILDREN. CHILDHOOD OBESITY THE PROACTIVE KIDS (PAK) PROGRAM IS AN EIGHT WEEK WEIGHT LOSS AND FITNESS PROGRAM THAT TARGETS CHILDREN AGES 8-18 WHO ARE IN THE 85TH PERCENTILE AND ABOVE FOR BMI, RESIDING IN THE HOSPITALS' PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SERVICE AREAS AND REFERRED BY A PHYSICIAN. PAK IS OFFERED THREE TIMES EACH CALENDAR YEAR AND CAN ACCOMMODATE A MAXIMUM OF 30 CHILDREN AT EACH SESSION. IN 2014, THE PAK PROGRAM IN OAK LAWN HAD 66 REGISTERED PARTICIPANTS. THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO INTRODUCE HEALTHIER LIFESTYLE OPTIONS TO CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH FITNESS, NUTRITION AND LIFESTYLE COACHING. THE GOAL IS TO IMPROVE CHILDRENS'S HEALTH BY PROVIDING TOOLS TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN A HEALTHY WEIGHT, BMI AND FITNESS LEVEL. PAK TRAINERS FOLLOW A FITNESS PROGRAM ESTABLISHED BY RIGHT FIT SPORT WELLNESS THAT INCLUDES THREE 45-MINUTE SESSIONS EACH WEEK DESIGNED TO INCREASE MUSCULAR ENDURANCE AND STRENGTH, CARDIOVASCULAR ENDURANCE, FLEXIBILITY AND REDUCE BODY FAT/BMI. NUTRITIONAL HEALTH ACTIVITIES ARE LED BY LICENSED DIETICIANS AND A FAMILY-INCLUSIVE APPROACH IS USED TO PROMOTE MAKING LIFESTYLE CHANGES TOGETHER LEADING TO HEALTHIER EATING HABITS. EACH 40-MINUTE NUTRITION LESSON ENGAGES THE ENTIRE FAMILY TO DISCUSS PROPER NUTRITION AS WELL AS TOOLS FOR MAKING HEALTHY SNACKS AND MEAL PREPARATION. COUNSELORS FOLLOW A CURRICULUM DESIGNED BY MEIER CLINICS TO REINFORCE CONFIDENCE, ENCOURAGE COMMUNICATION AND TEACH VALUABLE COPING SKILLS TO EMPOWER KIDS TO TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR LIVES AND DECISIONS. PROGRAM DATA IS GATHERED BY THE FITNESS TEAM PRE-PAK ENROLLMENT, WEEK 1 AND WEEK 8 USING PROGRESSION SURVEYS AND BODY COMPOSITION MEASUREMENTS INCLUDING WEIGHT, BMI, BODY FAT, FAT MASS, FAT FREE MASS, AND HIP TO WAIST RATIO. THE PROGRAM OBJECTIVES WERE TO: * INCREASE MUSCLE AND DECREASE BODY FAT AND BMI FOR ATTENDEES - IN 2014, FOR ALL PARTICIPANTS, BODY FAT DECREASED AN AVERAGE OF 2.5%; BMI DECREASED BY 1.23 POINTS; AVERAGE WEIGHT DECREASED BY 3.08 POUNDS. SEVENTY ONE PERCENT OF PAK PARENTS REPORTED PERSONAL WEIGHT LOSS AS A RESULT OF THEIR CHILD'S PARTICIPATION IN PAK. * CREATE HEALTHIER FOOD SELECTION, COOKING AND EATING HABITS - NUTRITIONISTS PROVIDED WEEKLY EDUCATION TO CHILDREN AND THEIR PARENTS REGARDING HEALTHY CHOICES AND FOOD PREPARATION. ONE HUNDRED PERCENT OF FAMILY MEMBERS REPORTED AN IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR CHILD'S ATTITUDE TOWARD DIET AND NUTRITION IN THE PROGRESSION SURVEY COMPLETED AT THE END OF THE EIGHT-WEEK SESSION. * BUILD CONFIDENCE AND INCREASE COMMUNICATION AND COPING SKILLS - WEEKLY LESSONS WERE TAUGHT TO GIVE PARTICIPANTS NEW SKILLS. ONE HUNDRED PERCENT OF PAK PARENTS REPORTED THEIR CHILD'S CONFIDENCE, COMMUNICATION AND COPING SKILLS HAD IMPROVED IN THE PROGRESSION SURVEY COMPLETED AT THE END OF THE EIGHT-WEEK SESSION. VIOLENCE VIOLENCE IS A SIGNIFICANT PROBLEM IN MANY NEIGHBORHOODS IN CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER'S TOTAL SERVICE AREA. THE COMMUNITIES WITH THE HIGHEST RATES OF VIOLENCE ARE ROSELAND, ENGLEWOOD, CHICAGO LAWN/WEST LAWN, GRAND BOULEVARD AND WOODLAWN. GIVEN THAT CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER IS THE ONLY LEVEL 1 TRAUMA CENTER SERVING THESE COMMUNITIES, THE MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDES TRAUMA SERVICES TO A HIGH VOLUME OF GUNSHOT VICTIMS. TO ADDRESS GUN VIOLENCE IN CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER'S SERVICE AREA, THE MEDICAL CENTER HAS PARTNERED WITH CEASEFIRE WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING VIOLENCE IN THESE FIVE COMMUNITIES. CEASEFIRE IS A LOCAL BRANCH OF THE CURE VIOLENCE ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO STOP TRANSMISSION OF VIOLENCE AT THE SOURCE, WHILE ATLERING NORMS AND BEHAVIOR SO THAT FEWER PEOPLE ARE AFFECTED. HIGHLY TRAINED VIOLENCE INTERRRUPTERS -FORMER PERPETRATORS - AIM TO DISPRUPT CONFLICTS BEFORE THEY HAPPEN AND EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUT THE CONSEQUENCES OF VIOLENT BEHAVIOR. THE CEASEFIRE COLLABORATION'S OBJECTIVE IS TO REDUCE RETALIATORY VIOLENCE IN THE COMMUNITY FOLLOWING A VIOLENT INCIDENT. CEASEFIRE HAS ONE VIOLENCE INTERRUPTER ASSIGNED EXCLUSIVELY TO CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER WITH OTHERS AVAILABLE AS NEEDED. WHEN A VICTIM OF VIOLENCE IS TRANSPORTED TO CHRIST'S EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT, THE VIOLENCE INTERRUPTER MEETS WITH THE VICTIM'S FAMILY MEMBERS AND FRIENDS, PROVIDING COUNSELING BEFORE RETALIATION CAN BE INITIATED TO QUELL THE LIKELIHOOD OF ANOTHER ACT OF VIOLENCE OCCURRING. IN 2014, THIS VIOLENCE INTERRUPTER MET WITH 617 PATIENTS WHO WERE VICTIMS OF VIOLENCE. NINETY PERCENT OF THESE PATIENTS WERE ASSESSED FOR FOLLOW-UP NEEDS AND 97.9% WERE CONNECTED TO LONG-TERM COMMUNITY SUPPORT. ACCESS TO CARE FOR LOW-INCOME/UNDERINSURED AT-RISK CHILDREN AS EVIDENT IN ACMC'S CHNA, ACCESS TO CARE IS DIFFICULT FOR LOW INCOME, UNINSURED/UNDER-INSURED, AT-RISK CHILDREN IN CHRIST'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA. SEVERAL DATA SOURCES USED FOR THE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT CHNA) CONFIRM THE NEED FOR ACCESSIBLE, BASIC PEDIATRIC MEDICAL CARE IN CHRIST'S SERVICE AREA WHICH INCLUDES LARGE AREAS OF CHICAGO'S SOUTH SIDE WHERE STUDENTS ATTEND CHICAGO PUBLIC SCHOOLS (CPS). * 87% OF CPS STUDENTS ARE FROM LOW INCOME FAMILIES; 25% OF COOK COUNTY CHILDREN ARE LIVING IN POVERTY. * 37% OF CHILDREN IN COOK COUNTY COME FROM SINGLE PARENT FAMILIES. * 24% OF COOK COUNTY CHILDREN HAVE INADEQUATE SOCIAL SUPPORT. * AS OF THE FIRST DAY OF SCHOOL 2013, ONLY 40.92% OF CPS STUDENTS WERE IN COMPLIANCE WITH STATE MANDATED SCHOOL PHYSICALS AND IMMUNIZATIONS, LEAVING 158,000+ OUT OF COMPLIANCE. * THE OBESITY RATE FOR CHICAGO CHILDREN IS TWICE THE NATIONAL AVERAGE AND SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER IN BLACK AND HISPANIC CHILDREN THAN IN WHITE CHILDREN. * THE RATE OF SEXUALLY TRANSMITTED DISEASES IN COOK COUNTY WAS 671 PER 100,000 POPULATION VERSUS 469 PER 100,000 FOR THE STATE OF ILLINOIS. * THE RATE OF TEEN BIRTHS (15-19 YEARS) WAS 49 PER 1,000 POPULATION VS 22 IN THE U.S. * THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS AVAILABLE WAS 736:1 IN COOK COUNTY VERSUS 976:1 IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS. * CHICAGO HAS THE HIGHEST HOMICIDE RATE IN CITIES WITH OVER 1 MILLION POPULATION, POTENTIALLY LIMITING SAFE TRAVEL AND ACCESSIBILITY DUE, IN PART, TO PARENTAL AND PROVIDER FEAR AND CONCERN. GIVEN THIS INITIAL DATA, ACMC FURTHER REVIEWED AND PRIORITIZED THE COMMUNITIES OF HIGHEST NEED BASED ON DEMOGRAPHIC DATA AND USING THE DIGNITY HEALTH COMMUNITY NEEDS INDEX (CNI) FOR THE CHNA. THE RESULTS GAVE ACMC THE ABILITY TO FOCUS ON COMMUNITIES IN ITS SERVICE AREA WITH SPECIFIC BARRIERS TO HEALTH CARE ACCESS - NAMELY INCOME, CULTURE/LANGUAGE, EDUCATION, INSURANCE AND HOUSING. AS A RESULT, ACMC REFOCUSED WHERE THE SERVICES OF THE RONALD MCDONALD CARE MOBILE (RMCM) ARE PROVIDED. THE RMCM PROVIDES FREE PHYSICALS, IMMUNIZATIONS AND REFERRALS TO SPECIALISTS, DENTAL AND EYE CARE PROVIDERS AND PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS TO LOW INCOME, UNINSURED CHILDREN. THE GOAL IS TO IMPROVE CHILDREN'S HEALTH BY PROVIDING PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND IMPROVING RELATIONSHIPS WITH AREA FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTERS (FQHCS) AND OTHER HEALTH PARTNERS WHO CAN OFFER REFERRALS TO SPECIALTY CARE. THE FIRST OBJECTIVE WAS TO IMPROVE COMPLIANCE FOR SCHOOL PHYSICALS & IMMUNIZATIONS AT HIGH-NEED SCHOOLS. JANUARY - DECEMBER 2014, RMCM STAFF PROVIDED 3,448 VACCINES, 1,923 PHYSICALS AND 895 REFERRALS TO PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS, 84 REFERRALS TO DENTI

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: HEALTH NEEDS NOT SELECTED TO ADDRESS
ExplntnTxt: THE KEY HEALTH NEEDS IDENTIFIED THOUGH ACMC'S CHNA THAT WERE NOT SELECTED BY THE MEDICAL CENTER TO ADDRESS WERE HEART DISEASE, CANCER AND STROKE BECAUSE THEY HAVE PREVIOUSLY BEEN, AND CONTINUE TO BE, ADDRESSED THROUGH SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED CLINICAL PROGRAMS AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. HEART DISEASE ACMC'S HEART AND VASCULAR INSTITUTE (HVI) IS A PREMIER CARDIAC CARE CENTER IN ILLINOIS, PROVIDING STATE-OF-THE-ART DIAGNOSTICS, INTERVENTION AND REHABILITATION TO ADULTS AND CHILDREN IN THE MEDICAL CENTER'S SERVICE AREA. HVI PERFORMS MORE OPEN HEART SURGERIES ANNUALLY THAN ANY HOSPITAL IN ILLINOIS. STUDIES SHOW THAT PERFORMING LARGE NUMBERS OF PROCEDURES PRODUCES THE BEST POSSIBLE CLINICAL OUTCOMES, ULTIMATELY BENEFITTING ALL THE PATIENTS SERVED IN ACMC'S COMMUNITY. THE MEDICAL CENTER HAS ONE OF THE NATION'S LEADING VENTRICULAR ASSIST DEVICE (VAD) PROGRAMS FOR HEART TRANSPLANT AND ASSIST DEVICE. THIS PROGRAM OFFERS A BRIDGE TO TRANSPLANT THERAPY OR DESTINATION THERAPY FOR PATIENTS WHO ARE NOT TRANSPLANT CANDIDATES. ACMC'S HEART INSTITUTE FOR CHILDREN PROVIDES OPEN AND CLOSED HEART SURGERY, AND ATRIAL FIBRILLATION ABLATION TO TREAT CONGENITAL HEART DISEASES. THE INSTITUTE IS THE LARGEST PEDIATRIC HEART CENTER IN ILLINOIS. THE CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE CLINIC TREATS MORE THAN 1,000 PATIENTS PER YEAR AT ALL STAGES OF HEART FAILURE AND HAS EARNED DISEASE SPECIFIC CERTIFICATION FROM THE JOINT COMMISSION (TJC). THE COMPREHENSIVE CARDIAC REHABILITATION PROGRAM IS ALSO NATIONALLY CERTIFIED BY THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF CARDIAC AND PULMONARY REHABILITATION. FREQUENT COMMUNITY LECTURES AND HEALTH SCREENINGS, INCLUDING BLOOD PRESSURE, BLOOD SUGAR, BODY MASS INDEX AND ANKLE BRACHIAL INDEX FOR PERIPHERAL VASCULAR DISEASE, ARE PROVIDED TO THE COMMUNITY. ACMC ALSO FINANCIALLY SUPPORTS AND PARTNERS WITH THE MUSEUM OF SCIENCE AND INDUSTRY TO PROVIDE "LIVE...FROM THE HEART," A VIDEOCONFERENCE-BASED CARDIOVASCULAR EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS FROM SUBURBAN AND CHICAGO PUBLIC SCHOOLS. THE PROGRAM'S "REAL TIME" VIEWING OF OPEN HEART SURGERY IN THE OPERATING ROOM IMPRESSES UPON STUDENTS THE IMPORTANCE OF MAINTAINING GOOD CARDIAC HEALTH, AS WELL AS EXPOSING STUDENTS TO POTENTIAL INTEREST IN HEALTH CARE CAREERS. CANCER CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER HAS AND WILL CONTINUE TO ADDRESS ADULT AND PEDIATRIC CANCER CARE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE EXPERIENCE AND ADVANCED TECHNOLOGIES OF THE CANCER INSTITUTE. EACH YEAR, NEARLY 1,800 NEWLY DIAGNOSED CANCER PATIENTS SEEK CARE AT CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER. THESE VOLUMES HAVE MADE THE MEDICAL CENTER ONE OF THE MOST EXPERIENCED CANCER TREATMENT CENTERS IN ILLINOIS. ACMC IS ACCREDITED BY THE AMERICAN COLLEGE OF SURGEONS (ACS) AS A CANCER TEACHING MEDICAL CENTER, THE HIGHEST ACS DESIGNATION POSSIBLE FOR A NON-UNIVERSITY MEDICAL CENTER. CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER ALSO OFFERS LEADING-EDGE TECHNOLOGIES, INCLUDING MINIMALLY INVASIVE APPROACHES LIKE CYBERKNIFE RADIOSURGERY, VIDEO-ASSISTED THORACIC SURGERY (VATS) FOR LUNG TUMORS AND ENDOSCOPIC ULTRASOUND TO DETECT TUMORS TOO SMALL TO BE SEEN BY CT OR MRI SCANS. ALONG WITH THE FAMILY PHYSICIAN, ACMC ALSO COORDINATES SWIFT DIAGNOSTIC TESTING RESULTS TO HELP REDUCE PATIENT ANXIETY WHILE WAITING FOR RESULTS. COMMUNITY OUTREACH IS AN IMPORTANT COMPONENT TO CANCER CARE. CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER RECEIVED A RICE FOUNDATION GRANT, WHICH PROVIDES FOR DIRECTED EDUCATION AND SCREENING ON COLON CANCER AND COLONOSCOPY TO HIGH-RISK, LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS AS IDENTIFIED BY LOCAL RELIGIOUS CONGREGATIONS. REGULAR FREE SKIN CANCER SCREENINGS ARE ALSO PROVIDED AS WELL AS A VARIETY OF CANCER-RELATED EDUCATION PROGRAMS. GILDA'S CLUB OF CHICAGO HAS A SATELLITE SITE IN CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER'S OUTPATIENT PAVILION. THE CLUB OFFERS SUPPORT GROUPS AND SERVICES FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES DEALING WITH CANCER, WHETHER IT BE AS A SURVIVOR, A FAMILY MEMBER OR A FRIEND. THE ON-SITE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE PROVIDES HOUSING AND OTHER SUPPORT PRIMARILY TO FAMILIES OF CHILDREN HOSPITALIZED FOR CANCER, HEART SURGERY OR HIGH RISK BIRTH. THE KEYSER FAMILY PEDIATRIC CANCER CENTER PROVIDES ONE OF THE LARGEST, MOST COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMS IN THE MIDWEST TO TREAT CHILDHOOD CANCERS AND BLOOD DISORDERS INCLUDING LYMPHOMAS, LEUKEMIA, BRAIN TUMORS, KIDNEY TUMORS, SICKLE CELL DISEASE, APLASTIC ANEMIA, AND PLATELET AND WHITE CELL DISORDERS. THE KEYSER FAMILY PEDIATRIC CANCER CENTER IS AN ACTIVE MEMBER OF THE CHILDREN'S ONCOLOGY GROUP, AN INTERNATIONAL RESEARCH ORGANIZATION SPONSORED BY THE NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE, DEDICATED TO DEVELOPING STATE-OF-THE-ART TREATMENTS FOR CHILDHOOD CANCERS. STROKE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO SUFFER A STROKE ARE GUARANTEED THAT EXPERTS AT THE CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER NEUROSCIENCES INSTITUTE WILL APPLY INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS, INCLUDING NEURO-ENDOVASCULAR AND NEURO-INTERVENTIONAL OPTIONS. CHRIST MEDICAL CENTER IS AN ACCREDITED COMPREHENSIVE STROKE CENTER, TREATING MORE STROKE PATIENTS THAN ANY OTHER HOSPITAL IN THE CHICAGO AREA, AND IS EXPERIENCED IN RESPONDING QUICKLY TO SAVE BRAIN CELLS AND PRESERVE QUALITY OF LIFE. THE MEDICAL CENTER WAS RATED BY U.S. NEWS & WORLD REPORT AS A HIGH PERFORMING MEDICAL CENTER IN THE CHICAGO METROPOLITAN REGION IN NEUROLOGY AND NEUROSURGERY, AND HAS A DEDICATED STROKE NAVIGATOR TO GUIDE PATIENTS THROUGH DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT. THE NEUROSCIENCES INSTITUTE ALSO PROVIDES SEVERAL MONTHLY STROKE SUPPORT GROUPS AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES. THE STROKE EDUCATORS REGULARLY PROVIDE EDUCATION REGARDING STROKE RISK FACTORS THROUGHOUT THE MEDICAL CENTER'S SERVICE AREA. ADVOCATE LUTHERAN GENERAL HOSPITAL ADVOCATE LUTHERAN GENERAL HOSPITAL (ALGH) ASSESSED AND IDENTIFIED FOUR NEEDS FROM ITS CHNA AS PRIORITIES FOR HOSPITAL ACTION: 1) REDUCE CARDIOVASCULAR RISK AND DISEASE IN THE SOUTH ASIAN COMMUNITY; 2) REDUCE FALLS IN SENIORS 65 AND OLDER IN HOSPITAL SERVICE AREA; 3) REDUCE PREVELANCE OF SMOKING IN THE HOSPITAL SERVICE AREA; AND 4) CREATE A PROGRAM TO ADDRESS OVERALL HEALTH AND STRESS MANAGEMENT FOR WOMEN. AS OF DECEMBER 2014, THE FOLLOWING ACCOMPLISHMENTS ADDRESSED THESE PRIORITIES: 1)SOUTH ASIAN CARDIOVASCULAR RISK AND DISEASE. THE SOUTH ASIAN CARDIOVASCULAR CENTER (SACC): a) OFFERED COMMUNITY LECTURES EDUCATING OVER 5,000 SOUTH ASIANS ON THEIR FOUR TIMES GREATER RISK OF CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE; b) DEVELOPED A SACC SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE TO INCREASE AWARENESS; c) HOSTED RED SARI EVENT TO RAISE AWARENESS OF CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE IN SOUTH ASIAN WOMEN; d) LAUNCHED SAHEB (SOUTH ASIAN HEALTHY EATING BENEFITS CHICAGO); e) DESIGNED AND WENT LIVE WITH YOUTUBE SOUTH ASIAN "HEALTHY COOKING SERIES" WITH MASTER CHEF SEASON 2 FINALIST AND SACC ADVISORY BOARD MEMBER, SUZY SINGH; f) ESTABLISHED A PRIMARY/SECONDARY PREVENTION PRACTICE TO PROVIDE ETHNICALLY APPROPRIATE CARE TO OUTPATIENT SOUTH ASIANS (APPROXIMATELY 15-20 A MONTH); g) PROVIDED SOUTH ASIAN SPECIFIC DIABETES EDUCATION; h) OFFERED VISITS BY ALGH SOUTH ASIAN NURSE NAVIGATOR TO SOUTH ASIAN INPATIENTS THREE TIMES A WEEK TO PROVIDE BEDSIDE EDUCATION AND PATIENT ADVOCACY; i) COMPLETED TWO PRESENTATIONS BY MEDICAL DIRECTOR OF THE SACC, DR. SHOEB SITAFWALLA, ON SOUTH ASIAN CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE AT THE AMERICAN TAMIL ASSOCIATION NATIONAL CONFERENCE IN MAY 2014, AND THE NATIONAL LIPID ASSOCIATION MIDWEST CLINICAL UPDATE IN AUGUST 2014; j) PUBLISHED AN ARTICLE ON THE SOUTH ASIAN CARDIOVASCULAR EPIDEMIC IN LIPID SPIN, 6-9, SPRING 2014; k) CREATED RESEARCH COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE SACC AND LOYOLA UNIVERSITY, ENTITLED "A POLYMORPHIC MYBPC3 MUTATION AS A MAJOR RISK FACTOR OF HEART FAILURE IN SOUTH ASIAN POPULATION." 2) FALL PREVENTION - SENIOR POPULATION: a) OFFERED THREE MATTER OF BALANCE (MOB) CLASSES IN THE COMMUNITY (WITH 30 TOTAL PARTICIPANTS); b) MADE ADDITIONAL PRESENTATIONS TO ANOTHER 30 PEOPLE IN COMMUNITY TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF FALL RISK; c) PRE AND POST-SURVEY FROM MATTER OF BALANCE CLASSES INDICATED A 25% INCREASE IN PARTICIPANTS CONFIDENCE IN THEIR ABILITY TO PROTECT THEMSELVES IF THEY FALL (NATIONAL AVERAGE 30%); A 19.23% INCREASE IN PARTICIPANTS PERSONAL COMMITMENT TO EXERCISE (NATIONAL AVERAGE 15.88%); AND A 45.45% INCREASE IN PARTICIPANTS CONFIDENCE RELATED TO CONTROLLING THEIR ENVIRONMENT TO REDUCE FALL RISKS (NATIONAL AVERAGE 23.26%). 3)SMOKING CESSATION: a) ALGH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH/ADDICTION MEDICINE MADE A COMMITMENT TO DEVELOP A SMOKING CESSATION CLINIC AFTER ASSESSING THAT AN INITIAL 1:1 SMOKING CESSATION COUNSELING DESIGN WAS NOT MEETING OBJECTIVES; b) SELECTED AN EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAM FOLLOWING LITERATURE REVIEW, "STANDARD FOR TRAINING IN SMOKING CESSATION AS OUTLINED IN THE MANUAL OF SMOKING CESSATION: A GUIDE FOR COUNSELORS AND PRACTITIONERS," ANDY MCEWEN AND ROBERT WEST; c) CREATED FINAL HOSPITAL PROGRAM BASED ON ABOVE PROGRAM BY COMBINING MEDICAL MANAGEMENT AND GROUP COUNSELING SESSIONS WITH THE FIRST SESSION SET FOR JANUARY 2015. 4) STRESS MANAGEMENT: a) PARTNERED WITH THE PARK RIDGE PARK DISTRICT TO PROVIDE THREE SESSIONS OF "HEALTHY WOMEN A-Z," A PROGRAM DESIGNED TO ENHANCE STRESS MANAGEMENT THROUGH FITNESS AND ST

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: 4) OTHER SPECIFIC PROGRAMS ADDRESSING CULTURAL HEALTH DISPARITIES
ExplntnTxt: SINCE 2011, ADVOCATE LUTHERAN GENERAL HOSPITAL HAS BEEN ON A JOURNEY TO IDENTIFY NEEDS OF SPECIFIC CULTURAL GROUPS AND DESIGN PROGRAMS TO MEET THESE NEEDS. THIS INITIATIVE WILL CONTINUE ALTHOUGH THE NEED WAS NOT SELECTED AS A PRIORITY FROM THE CHNA. IN MAY 2011, A KOREAN NAVIGATOR, AN ADVANCED PRACTICE NURSE, WAS HIRED TO: (1) TRANSFORM THE DELIVERY OF CARE FOR THE ALGH KOREAN-AMERICAN POPULATION; (2) CREATE A KOREAN-AMERICAN HEALTH EDUCATION PROGRAM; (3) CREATE A KOREAN-AMERICAN HEALTH SCREENING PROGRAM; AND 4) BUILD A PROCESS TO CONTINUALLY ASSESS, IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS SPECIFIC HEALTH NEEDS IN THE KOREAN-AMERICAN COMMUNITY. A SEPARATE IN-DEPTH COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT OF THE KOREAN-AMERICAN COMMUNITY WAS COMPLETED IN DECEMBER 2014 WITH THE HANUL FAMILY ALLIANCE, A COMMUNITY PARTNER THAT WILL BE THE FOUNDATION FOR NEW PROGRAMMING MOVING FORWARD. IN DECEMBER 2012, A POLISH PATIENT NAVIGATOR WAS HIRED INITIALLY TO FOCUS ON BREAST HEALTH, BUT WILL BEGIN ADDRESSING COLORECTAL HEALTH AND COMPLETING A FULL HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT FOR THE POLISH COMMUNITY IN THE 2014-2016 COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT CYCLE. WHILE THE ACCESS GENESIS CLINIC IN DES PLAINES (ORIGINALLY FOUNDED BY ADVOCATE LUTHERAN GENERAL HOSPITAL) CONTINUES TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE HISPANIC COMMUNITY IN LUTHERAN GENERAL'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA (PSA), A MORE IN-DEPTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE UPCOMING 2014-2016 CHNA CYCLE. 2014-2016 COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT AS PART OF ORGANIZING FOR THE 2014-2016 CHNA PROCESS, THE HOSPITAL MAINTAINED ITS REGULAR MEETING SCHEDULE FOR THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL IN 2014 AND RECRUITED A SECOND KEY INDIVIDUAL FROM THE COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH TO SERVE ON THE COUNCIL. ADVOCATE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL THE TWO PRIORITY NEEDS SELECTED BY THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL FOR THE HOSPITAL TO ADDRESS WERE CHILDHOOD OVERWEIGHT AND OBESITY, AND FALLS AMONG SENIORS. OVERWEIGHT AND OBESITY TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF OVERWEIGHT AND OBESE CHILDREN, GOOD SAMARITAN HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTER AND ADVOCATE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL (AGSAM) ARE PARTNERING WITH THE PROACTIVE KIDS (PAK) FOUNDATION AND THE FORWARD INITIATIVE (FIGHTING OBESITY REACHING HEALTHY WEIGHT AMONG RESIDENTS OF DUPAGE). PROACTIVE KIDS (PAK) PROACTIVE KIDS TEACHES KIDS AND THEIR FAMILIES' FUN WAYS TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND DECREASE WEIGHT THROUGH A THREE PART PROGRAM: PAK FITNESS, PAK NUTRITION AND PAK LIFESTYLE COACHING. PAK IS OPEN TO CHILDREN 8-14 YEARS OLD WHO HAVE A BMI IN THE 85 PERCENTILE OR HIGHER. THIS FREE 8-WEEK PROGRAM INCLUDES PHYSICAL TRAINING, COUNSELING, NUTRITION AND GUIDED DISCUSSION. PARENTS ALSO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM WHICH EDUCATES FAMILIES TOGETHER IN ENGAGING AND SUSTAINABLE WAYS TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH THROUGH WEEKLY PHYSICAL EXERCISE, LESSONS AND ASSIGNMENTS. DATA IS COLLECTED AT THE BEGINNING AND END OF EACH 8-WEEK SESSION TO MEASURE WEIGHT, BMI, BODY FAT, FAT MASS AND FAT FREE MASS. OBJECTIVE #1: INCREASE COMMITMENT TO FITNESS AMONG PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS BY IMPLEMENTING THREE PROACTIVE KIDS (PAK) PLAN SESSIONS EACH YEAR FROM 2014-2016 FOR A TOTAL OF 9 EIGHT-WEEK SESSIONS. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: IN 2014, 3 EIGHT-WEEK SESSIONS OF PROACTIVE KIDS WERE OFFERED. (WINTER, SUMMER AND FALL) 1. IN WINTER OF 2014, 64% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 19) ATTENDING DAY 1 COMPLETED THE 8-WEEK PROGRAM. 2. IN SUMMER OF 2014, 50% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 24) ATTENDING DAY 1 COMPLETED THE 8-WEEK PROGRAM. 3. IN FALL OF 2014, 64% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (16 OF 25) ATTENDING DAY 1 COMPLETED THE 8-WEEK PROGRAM. 4. IN WINTER OF 2014, 100% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 12) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY HAD AN IMPROVED COMMITMENT TO THEIR FITNESS. 5. IN SUMMER OF 2014, 89% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (8 OF 9) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY HAD AN IMPROVED COMMITMENT TO THEIR FITNESS. 6. IN FALL OF 2014, 100% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (14 OF 14) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY HAD AN IMPROVED COMMITMENT TO THEIR FITNESS. OBJECTIVE #2: CREATE HEALTHIER HABITS IN FOOD SELECTION, COOKING & EATING AND NUTRITION KNOWLEDGE AMONG PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS BY IMPLEMENTING THREE PROACTIVE KIDS (PAK) PLAN PROGRAMS EACH YEAR FROM 2014-2016 FOR A TOTAL OF 9 SESSIONS. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: 1. IN WINTER OF 2014, 100% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 12) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY HAD A POSITIVE ATTITUDE CHANGE TOWARD THEIR DIET AND NUTRITION. 2. IN SUMMER OF 2014, 89% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (8 OF 9) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY HAD A POSITIVE ATTITUDE CHANGE TOWARD THEIR DIET AND NUTRITION. 3. IN FALL OF 2014, 93% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (14 OF 15) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY HAD A POSITIVE ATTITUDE CHANGE TOWARD THEIR DIET AND NUTRITION. OBJECTIVE #3: BUILD CONFIDENCE, INCREASE COMMUNICATION & TEACH COPING SKILLS AMONG PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS BY IMPLEMENTING THREE PROACTIVE KIDS (PAK) PLAN PROGRAMS EACH YEAR FROM 2014-2016 FOR A TOTAL OF 9 SESSIONS. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: 1. IN WINTER OF 2014, 58% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (7 OF 12) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY RECOGNIZED AN IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT. 2. IN SUMMER OF 2014, 88% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (7 OF 8) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY RECOGNIZED AN IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT. 3. IN FALL OF 2014, 86% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 14) THAT COMPLETED SURVEY RECOGNIZED AN IMPROVEMENT IN SOCIAL ENGAGEMENT. FORWARD INITIATIVE THE FORWARD INITIATIVE IS A BROAD-BASED COMMUNITY COALITION IN DUPAGE COUNTY THAT COLLABORATES TO PROMOTE EFFECTIVE AND SUSTAINABLE POLICY, SYSTEM, AND ENVIRONMENTAL (PSE) STRATEGIES FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES TO ACHIEVE A HEALTHY WEIGHT. OBJECTIVE #1: IDENTIFY EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS TO REDUCE OBESITY THROUGH EFFECTIVE AND SUSTAINABLE POLICY, SYSTEM AND ENVIRONMENTAL (PSE) CHANGE STRATEGIES TO REVERSE THE TREND OF OBESITY IN DUPAGE COUNTY. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: PSE CHANGES 1. IN 2014-2015, ACHIEVED 15 POLICY AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES WITH 5 CHILD CARE CENTERS IN AGSAM'S SECONDARY SERVICE AREA. OBJECTIVE #2: REDUCE THE PREVALENCE OF OVERWEIGHT AND OBESITY AMONG DUPAGE COUNTY SCHOOL CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS (KINDERGARTEN, 6TH AND 9TH GRADES) FROM 2010-2011 BASELINE OF 31.1% (N=11,496). ACCOMPLISHMENTS: REDUCTION IN OVERWEIGHT AND OBESITY RATES 1. THE OVERALL OVERWEIGHT AND OBESITY RATES AS MEASURED BY THE 2013-2014 BMI RATES REMAINED STEADY (29.7%, N=30, 174) AFTER DUPAGE COUNTY EXPERIENCED A 1% STATISTICALLY SIGNIFICANT DECREASE, IN 2012-2013 FROM 31.1% TO 29.9% (N=27,914). 2. OVERALL OBESITY ONLY RATES WERE REDUCED FROM 15.1% IN THE 2010-2011 BASELINE YEARS, TO 14.4% BY 2013-2014, AFTER AN INCREASE IN OVERALL OBESITY OF 0.3% IN 2011-2012. SENIOR HEALTH DATA FROM THE HOSPITAL'S TRAUMA REGISTRY INDICATED FALLS AMONG SENIORS AS THE NUMBER ONE REASON FOR ADMISSION INTO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT. A MATTER OF BALANCE (MOB) IS AN EVIDENCE-BASED, LAY LED MODEL, DEVELOPED BY BOSTON UNIVERSITY THAT IS APPROPRIATE FOR SENIORS LIVING IN PEACE MEMORIAL MANOR AND FOR SENIORS LIVING IN THE HOSPITAL'S BROADER PRIMARY SERVICE AREA (PSA). IT IS AN 8-SESSION PROGRAM THAT INCORPORATES PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, EDUCATION AND SMALL GROUP DISCUSSION. THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM ARE TO IMPROVE ATTITUDES AND ALLEVIATE A FEAR OF FALLING THROUGH INCREASING PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AS MEASURED BY PRE- AND POST-CLASS SURVEYS. RESEARCH FROM BOSTON UNIVERSITY INDICATES THAT SENIORS WHO FEEL IN CONTROL OF THEIR FEAR OF FALLING ARE MORE ACTIVE AND THOSE SENIORS WHO ARE MORE ACTIVE ARE LESS LIKELY TO FALL. WHILE ONLY ONE CLASS SERIES WAS IMPLEMENTED DURING 2014, THE HOSPITAL ANTICIPATES EXPANSION OF THIS PROGRAM INTO ADDITIONAL INDEPENDENT AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES AS WELL AS DEVELOPMENT OF PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY GROUPS TO BRING MATTER OF BALANCE TO INDEPENDENT SENIORS AT RISK FOR FALLS IN THE PSA. OBJECTIVE #1: SENIORS PARTICIPATING IN MATTER OF BALANCE PROGRAM LEARN TO VIEW FALLS AND FEAR OF FALLING AS CONTROLLABLE. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: 1. IN MAY 2014, 100% OF THE 12 SENIORS WHO ATTENDED MATTER OF BALANCE (MOB) COMPLETED 5 OUT OF 8 CLASSES REQUIRED TO GRADUATE. 2. IN NOVEMBER 2014, 89% OF THE 9 SENIORS WHO ATTENDED MATTER OF BALANCE (MOB) COMPLETED 5 OUT OF 8 CLASSES REQUIRED TO GRADUATE. 3. IN MAY 2014, 100% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 12) SELF-REPORTED FEELING MORE COMFORTABLE TALKING WITH OTHERS ABOUT HIS/HER FEAR OF FALLING. 4. IN NOVEMBER 2014, 83% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (5 OF 6) SELF-REPORTED FEELING MORE COMFORTABLE TALKING WITH OTHERS ABOUT HIS/HER FEAR OF FALLING. 5. MOB COACH TRAININGS WERE CONDUCTED ON MARCH 13 AND NOVEMBER 13, 2014, FOR 6 COACHES TO LEAD MOB CLASSES. OBJECTIVE #2: SENIORS PARTICIPATING IN MATTER OF BALANCE PROGRAM SET REALISTIC GOALS TO INCREASE ACTIVITY. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: 1. IN MAY 2014, 100% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (12 OF 12) REPORTED ON THE POST SURVEY THAT THEY PLAN TO CONTINUE EXERCISING. 2. IN NOVEMBER 2014, 100% OF THE PARTICIPANTS (6 OF 6) REPORTED ON THE POST SURVEY THAT THEY PLAN TO CONTINUE EXERCISING. OBJECTIVE #3: SENIORS PARTICIPATING IN MATTER OF BALANCE PROGRAM CHANGE THEIR ENVIRONMENT TO REDUCE FALL RISK FACTORS. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: 1. FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: NEEDS NOT SELECTED TO ADDRESS
ExplntnTxt: THERE ARE FOUR AREAS OF NEED FOR WHICH THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL DID NOT CHOOSE PRIORITY ACTION BECAUSE THEY HAVE PREVIOUSLY BEEN, AND CONTINUE TO BE ADDRESSED, THROUGH SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED CLINICAL PROGRAMS AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. THESE AREAS COMPRISE MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, ACCESS TO CARE, SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND INFECTIOUS DISEASE. MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL DECIDED NOT TO FOCUS ON MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES AT THIS TIME. WHILE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL PROVIDES SIGNIFICANT MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES FOR ADULT AND GERIATRIC POPULATIONS, THE HOSPITAL DOES NOT HAVE EXPERTISE WITH CHILD AND ADOLESCENT BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PATIENTS. ADDITIONALLY, DUE TO A VARIETY OF REASONS, THE HOSPITAL IS CURRENTLY EXPERIENCING A SHORTAGE OF PSYCHIATRISTS AND DOES NOT HAVE THE STAFFING RESOURCES TO EXPAND COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES AT THIS TIME. HOWEVER, GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL DOES PARTNER WITH SEVERAL ORGANIZATIONS TO OFFER SUPPORT GROUPS AND PROGRAMMING DEDICATED TO PROVIDING ASSISTANCE AND ENCOURAGEMENT TO PATIENTS WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONCERNS. THESE INCLUDE: * NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS (NAMI) CONNECTION, RECOVERY SUPPORT GROUP PROGRAM FOR ADULTS LIVING WITH MENTAL ILLNESS. * NAMI FAMILY SUPPORT GROUP * FAMILIES AND MENTAL ILLNESS...LEARNING, INSPIRING, EDUCATION AND SUPPORT (F.A.M.I.L.I.E.S) LED BY NAMI COUNSELORS AND HELD AT ADVOCATE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL * GOOD SAMARITAN'S DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SUPPORT GROUP * DEPRESSION AND BIPOLAR SUPPORT ALLIANCE * DEMENTIA SUPPORT GROUP ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE ACCORDING TO THE AGENCY FOR HEALTHCARE RESEARCH AND QUALITY, ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE IS THE THIRD MOST IMPORTANT FACTOR NEEDED FOR A HEALTHY COMMUNITY. HOWEVER, SINCE THE HOSPITAL IS ALREADY MAKING MAJOR FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS (AND WILL CONTINUE TO DO SO) AND IS COLLABORATING WITH MULTIPLE COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO ADDRESS HEALTH ACCESS NEEDS, THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL HAS CHOSEN NOT TO EXPAND FOCUS INTO THIS AREA DURING THE 2011-2013 THREE-YEAR CHNA CYCLE. ACCESS DUPAGE FOR MORE THAN TEN YEARS, GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL HAS PARTNERED WITH ACCESS DUPAGE AND HAS PROVIDED CASH DONATIONS AND CHARITY CARE FOR ACCESS DUPAGE PARTICIPANTS. ACCESS DUPAGE REPRESENTS A UNIQUE PARTNERSHIP OF HOSPITALS, PHYSICIANS, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, HUMAN SERVICES AGENCIES AND COMMUNITY GROUPS WORKING TOGETHER LOCALLY TO ADDRESS THE LOCAL ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE NEEDS. QUALIFIED APPLICANTS ARE TYPICALLY ENROLLED IN THE ACCESS DUPAGE PROGRAM FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR, AFTER WHICH THEY MUST RE-APPLY FOR MEMBERSHIP IN THE PROGRAM AND THEIR ELIGIBILITY MUST BE RE-VERIFIED. MEMBERSHIP IN THE ACCESS DUPAGE PROGRAM PROVIDES ACCESS TO MEDICAL SERVICES TO DUPAGE COUNTY'S LOW-INCOME, MEDICALLY UNINSURED RESIDENTS. IN ADDITION TO SUPPORTING ACCESS DUPAGE WITH DONATIONS, GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL ACCEPTS QUALIFIED PARTICIPANTS AT ITS SITES OF CARE FOR DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT AT NO COST. THE HOSPITAL ALSO ENCOURAGES PHYSICIANS ON ITS MEDICAL STAFF TO TAKE THESE PATIENTS INTO THEIR MEDICAL PRACTICES AT NO COST. THESE PHYSICIANS THEN BECOME THE MEDICAL HOME FOR ACCESS DUPAGE MEMBERS. ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS MUST: * RESIDE IN DUPAGE COUNTY FOR AT LEAST 30 DAYS * BE UNDER AGE 65 * HAVE A HOUSEHOLD INCOME BELOW 200% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL * HAVE NO MEDICAL INSURANCE * BE INELIGIBLE FOR PRIVATE OR PUBLIC HEALTH COVERAGE PROGRAMS (E.G., MEDICAID, MEDICARE, VETERANS BENEFITS, ETC.). IN 2014, THE HOSPITAL CONTRIBUTED OVER $834,218 IN DIRECT CASH DONATIONS TO SUPPORT PROGRAM OPERATIONS AND $2,367,026 FOR SERVICES FOR ACCESS DUPAGE PARTICIPANTS. THE DECREASE OF CASH DONATIONS AND SERVICES OF $10,946,372 FROM 2013 REPORTED FIGURE OF $13,310,753 IS DUE TO THE MANY ACCESS DUPAGE PATIENTS NOW ELIGIBLE FOR THE EXPANDED MEDICAID SERVICES. WHY WAIT CLINIC A SECOND LONG-TERM COMMUNITY COLLABORATION IS THE "WHY WAIT CLINIC," IN COOPERATION WITH THE DUPAGE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES UNDERSERVED, UNINSURED, UNDERINSURED AND LOW-INCOME WOMEN ACCESS TO FREE SCREENING BREAST AND PELVIC EXAMS; PAP SMEARS; AND MAMMOGRAMS AS WELL AS DIAGNOSTIC BIOPSIES AND SURGERIES; AND TREATMENT WHEN NECESSARY. IN 2014, GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL PROVIDED 239 SERVICES TO DUPAGE COUNTY WOMEN. USE OF GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL'S DIAGNOSTIC IMAGING SUITES AND STAFF RESULTED IN A TOTAL COMMUNITY BENEFIT OF $477,367. ENGAGE DUPAGE ENGAGE DUPAGE IS A COLLABORATIVE INITIATIVE IMPLEMENTED IN OCTOBER OF 2014 BY THE DUPAGE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND ADVOCATE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF SELF-PAY, MANG-PENDING AND MEDICAID PATIENTS WHO HAVE BEHAVIORAL/MENTAL HEALTH PROBLEMS, ARE CHEMICALLY DEPENDENT AND/OR ARE CONSIDERED TO BE "AT RISK" (I.E., PATIENTS WHO USE THE ED TO MANAGE THEIR CHRONIC CONDITIONS SUCH AS ASTHMA, COPD, HEART DISEASE DIABETES, HYPERTENSION, ETC.). A COMMUNITY RESOURCE LIAISON (CRL) FROM THE DUPAGE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (DCHD) IS PLACED IN GSAM'S EMERGENCY ROOM DURING THE DAYS AND TIMES THAT CORRESPOND TO THE HEAVIEST ED TRAFFIC. THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE: 1) IMPROVING THE HEALTH STATUS OF PATIENTS WHO ARE SELF-PAY, MANG-PENDING, AND MEDICAID BY ENROLLING PERSONS IN PROGRAMS FOR WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE THROUGH A FOCUSED POPULATION-BASED HEALTH PARTNERSHIP; AND 2) CONNECTING FREQUENT ED USERS (DEFINED AS PATIENTS USING THE ED TWICE IN ONE MONTH OR MORE THAN 4 TIMES WITHIN A 6-MONTH ROLLING TIME FRAME) TO A MEDICAL HOME OR COMMUNITY PROGRAM TO HELP DECREASE THE NEED FOR UNNECESSARY ED VISITS. EXPECTED RESULTS OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE: 1. HEALTH COVERAGE - FOR ALL PATIENTS THAT ATTEND A FOLLOW-UP APPOINTMENT, ACHIEVE A 50% ENROLLMENT INTO A FORM OF HEALTH COVERAGE. IN THE FOURTH QUARTER OF 2014, ACHIEVED 32% ENROLLMENT (24 APPROVED ENROLLMENTS OF 74 APPOINTMENTS). 2. FREQUENT USE - PATIENTS WHO ARE FREQUENT USERS WITH COMORBIDITIES RELATED TO BH/MENTAL HEALTH AND "AT-RISK" AND ARE SELF-PAY OR MEDICAID, ACHIEVE A 50% DECREASE IN ER VISITS. IN THE FOURTH QUARTER OF 2014, ACHIEVED 17.5% PATIENT DECREASE FROM BASELINE. 3. ENROLLMENT IN APPROPRIATE COMMUNITY PROGRAMS - PATIENTS WHO ARE BH/MENTAL HEALTH, CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY AND "AT-RISK" AND ATTEND A FOLLOW-UP APPOINTMENT, ACHIEVE A 40% ENROLLMENT RATE INTO A COMMUNITY PROGRAM (E.G., DUPAGE COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES). IN THE FOURTH QUARTER OF 2014, 177 PATIENT CONTACTS WERE INITIATED WITH 110 BENEFITTING APPOINTMENTS SCHEDULED. OF THE 110 APPOINTMENTS SCHEDULED, 74 PATIENTS ATTENDED THEIR FOLLOW-UP APPOINTMENTS. 46 OF THE 74 PATIENTS WHO ATTENDED A FOLLOW-UP APPOINTMENT (OR 62%) COMPLETED APPLICATIONS AND WERE ENROLLED IN COMMUNITY PROGRAMS: 18 IN DCHD PROGRAMS, 6 IN SNAP, 1 IN ACCESS DUPAGE, AND 21 BETWEEN ADULT MEDICAID, ALL KIDS, AND MPE. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN GSAM AND DCHD IN THE ENGAGE DUPAGE COLLABORATIVE IS A CONTRACTUAL ONE. AS PART OF THE AGREEMENT, THE CRL POSITION IS A PAID POSITION OF THE DUPAGE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT WHILE THE HOSPITAL PROVIDES THE WORKSPACE, ACCESS TO THE TECHNOLOGY NEEDED TO DO THE WORK (E.G., TELEPHONES, COMPUTER, EMR, ETC.) AND ORIENTATION TO THE WORK TEAM IN THE ED. GSAM IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR GATHERING PERTINENT DATA AND PROVIDING IT TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT TO ASSIST THEM IN MONITORING AND REPORTING OUTCOMES. AN ADDITIONAL BARRIER TO ACCESSING HEALTH CARE IS LANGUAGE. COMMUNICATION IS CRITICAL TO A PATIENT'S UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR PLAN OF CARE. LACK OF COMMUNICATION DUE TO LANGUAGE BARRIERS OR DEAFNESS CAN IMPEDE THAT UNDERSTANDING. INTERPRETER SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY THE HOSPITAL, AT NO COST, TO PATIENTS WHO NEED THEM. THE DUPAGE COUNTY COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT INDICATES AN INCREASE IN ETHNIC AND CULTURAL DIVERSITY, ESPECIALLY IN THE HISPANIC POPULATION IN DUPAGE COUNTY. ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE CAN BE CHALLENGING FOR A VARIETY OF REASONS, BUT THESE DIFFICULTIES ARE MULTIPLIED FOR PEOPLE WITH DECREASED COMMUNICATION CAPACITY AND VARIED CULTURAL DIFFERENCES. DIFFICULTY COMMUNICATING CAN ALSO COMPOUND LOW HEALTH LITERACY. GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL CONTINUES TO EXPAND ACCESS TO CARE WITH MEDICAL INTERPRETERS FOR LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENT PATIENTS WHO WOULD OTHERWISE NOT BE ABLE TO COMMUNICATE AND UNDERSTAND THEIR PLAN OF CARE. IN 2010, THREE FULL-TIME, ON-SITE, SPANISH INTERPRETERS, IN COMBINATION WITH OUTSIDE AGENCY INTERPRETERS, PROVIDED COMMUNICATION ASSISTANCE FOR 5,645 ENCOUNTERS. SERVICES WERE PROVIDED AT THE MAIN HOSPITAL AS WELL AS AT THE LEMONT, WOODRIDGE, AND DOWNERS GROVE OUTPATIENT CENTERS AND THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS CENTER AT A COST OF $468,379 TO THE HOSPITAL. BY 2012, THE NEED FOR INTERPRETERS HAD RISEN 29%, CLIMBING TO 7,292 ENCOUNTERS AT A COST OF $756,237 WITH REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE IN MORE THAN 40 DIFFERENT LANGUAGES AT THE MAIN HOSPITAL CAMPUS AND OFFSITE LOCATIONS. IN 2013, THE LANGUAGE ASSISTANCE COSTS FOR THE HOSPITAL INCREASED TO $888,077. IN 2014, THE LANGUAGE ASSISTANCE COST TO THE HOSPITAL DECREASED TO $528,943 DUE TO AN IMPROVED CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENT WITH THE HOSPITAL'S SERVICE PROVIDER BY USING INTERPRE

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: INFECTIOUS DISEASE
ExplntnTxt: THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL RECOMMENDED NOT FOCUSING ON INFECTIOUS DISEASE AT THIS TIME AS THE NEED FOR SEASONAL FLU VACCINES AND PNEUMOCOCCAL VACCINES IN THE COMMUNITY ARE CURRENTLY BEING FILLED BY THE RETAIL SECTOR. ADVOCATE HEALTH CARE IMPLEMENTED A MANDATORY FLU VACCINE PROGRAM IN 2011 THAT INCLUDES GOOD SAMARITAN STAFF, PHYSICIANS AND VOLUNTEERS. STUDIES HAVE SHOWN THAT WHEN HEALTH CARE WORKERS GET FLU SHOTS, THE NUMBER OF PATIENTS WITH INFLUENZA-LIKE ILLNESS GREATLY DECREASES, AS DOES PATIENT MORTALITY. SINCE THE INCEPTION OF MANDATORY FLU VACCINATION, DEATHS FROM HOSPITAL-ACQUIRED INFLUENZA HAVE BEEN ELIMINATED FOR THE PERIODS 2011-2012 AND 2012-2013. IN ADDITION, THE NUMBER OF HOSPITAL-ACQUIRED INFLUENZA CASES HAS DECREASED FROM 3.2% TO 2% OF ALL FLU HOSPITALIZATIONS. ACCORDING TO THE DUPAGE COUNTY BEHAVIOR RISK FACTOR SURVEY (BRFS), THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL'S ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON IMMUNIZATION PRACTICES RECOMMENDS THAT ADULTS OVER AGE 65 RECEIVE ONE DOSE OF THE PNEUMONIA VACCINE IN THEIR LIFETIME. THE PNEUMONIA VACCINE IS ONLY RECOMMENDED FOR INDIVIDUALS BETWEEN THE AGES OF 19 AND 64 WHO SUFFER FROM A CHRONIC CONDITION. FOR THIS YOUNGER POPULATION, A ONE-TIME REVACCINATION IS ADVISED 5 YEARS AFTER THE INITIAL VACCINATION. THE PERCENTAGE OF ADULTS IN DUPAGE COUNTY WHO HAD EVER RECEIVED A PNEUMONIA VACCINE WAS 26.0% IN 2010. THIS PERCENTAGE IS COMPARABLE TO THE 2010 ILLINOIS PERCENTAGE OF 26.2. ASSESSMENT DATA COMPILED BY PROFESSIONAL RESEARCH CONSULTANTS (PRC) FOR GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL'S PSA INDICATES 59% OF RESPONDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE INFLUENZA VACCINES AND 77% OF RESPONDENTS DO NOT TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE PNEUMOCOCCAL VACCINE. HOWEVER, OF ADULTS 65 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER, 72.3% HAD A FLU VACCINE WITHIN THE PAST 12 MONTHS, A RATE HIGHER THAN THAT IN ILLINOIS IN 2010, AT 65.5%. LOCALLY, THE RETAIL SECTOR (OSCO DRUG, CVS PHARMACY AND WALGREENS IN DUPAGE COUNTY) PROMOTES THIS ENDEAVOR WITH TREMENDOUS ADVERTISING AND MAKES BOTH VACCINES READILY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC FOR A LOW COST. NEW COLLABORATIONS IN 2014 TO IMPLEMENT FOR NEXT CHNA CYCLE IN 2014, ADVOCATE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL BEGAN PARTICIPATING IN IMPACT DUPAGE, A GROUP OF COMMUNITY LEADERS AND ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TOGETHER TO DETERMINE COMMUNITY NEEDS AND PRIORITIES THAT WILL IMPROVE THE WELL-BEING OF THE DUPAGE COUNTY COMMUNITY. IMPACT DUPAGE IS CO-LED BY THE DUPAGE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND DUPAGE FEDERATION ON HUMAN SERVICES REFORM, AND INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL PARTNERS: * ACCESS DUPAGE * ADVENTIST MIDWEST HEALTH * ADVOCATE GOOD SAMARITAN HOSPITAL * CADENCE HEALTH * DUPAGE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION * DUPAGE COUNTY COMMUNITY SERVICES * DUPAGE COUNTY REGIONAL OFFICE OF EDUCATION * DUPAGE HEALTH COALITION * DUPAGE MAYORS AND MANAGERS CONFERENCE * DUPAGE PADS * EDWARD-ELMHURST HEALTHCARE * HOPE FAIR HOUSING * LOVE CHRISTIAN CLEARINGHOUSE * METROPOLITAN FAMILY SERVICES DUPAGE * NORTHERN ILLINOIS UNIVERSITY * PEOPLE'S RESOURCE CENTER * POSITIVE PARENTING DUPAGE * UNITED WAY OF DUPAGE/WEST COOK * WEGO TOGETHER FOR KIDS * YWCA METROPOLITAN CHICAGO ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL THROUGH A PRIORITY SETTING PROCESS, ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL'S COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL RECOMMENDED, AND THE HOSPITAL ADOPTED, FOCUSING ON THREE AREAS FOR PRIORITY ACTION, INCLUDING: FALLS AMONG SENIORS; CHILDHOOD OBESITY; AND CANCER PREVENTION AND DETECTION. ACCOMPLISHMENTS DURING 2014 IN THESE THREE AREAS ARE DESCRIBED BELOW. FALLS AMONG SENIORS FALLS AMONG SENIORS (65+) ARE A SIGNIFICANT HEALTH RISK AND THE NUMBER ONE CAUSE OF TRAUMA ADMISSIONS TO ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL. IN 2009, THE HOSPITAL'S COMMUNITY HEALTH COMMITTEE EMBARKED ON EFFORTS TO ADDRESS THIS RISK. SINCE THAT TIME, ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HAS CONDUCTED PROGRAMMING TO ADDRESS FALLS. IN 2012, FOUR GOOD SHEPHERD ASSOCIATES (EMPLOYEES) BECAME LICENSED MASTER TRAINERS UNDER THE MATTER OF BALANCE LAY LEAD MODEL WHICH UTILIZES COMMUNITY COACHES TO TEACH THE 8 SESSION CLASSES. AS A RESULT, THE HOSPITAL WAS ABLE TO CONDUCT 15 COMMUNITY CLASSES USING THE COACHING MODEL IN 2014. THE RESULTS FROM PARTICIPANTS SHOWED A 30 PERCENT IMPROVEMENT IN THEIR ABILITY TO REDUCE FALL RISK FACTORS IN THEIR LIVES. CHILDHOOD OBESITY IN THE 2013-14 ACADEMIC YEAR, OVER 10,000 (K-12) STUDENTS FROM 39 SCHOOLS PARTICIPATED IN ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL'S SCHOOL-BASED CHILDHOOD OBESITY PREVENTION PROGRAM KNOWN AS CATCH, THE COORDINATED APPROACH TO CHILD HEALTH. THIS PROGRAM ADDRESSES INTERVENTIONS TO IMPACT NUTRITION AND HEALTH. STUDENTS ARE TESTED FOR FITNESS LEVELS IN THE FALL AND SPRING AND THE RESULTS ARE COMPARED. RESULTS INDICATED A 4% IMPROVEMENT IN THE SAMPLE OF STUDENTS TESTED ACROSS 39 SCHOOLS. IN ADDITION, 44 ENVIRONMENTAL IMPROVEMENTS HAVE BEEN MADE IN SCHOOLS, SUCH AS IMPROVEMENTS IN NUTRITIONAL VALUE OF SNACKS IN VENDING MACHINES, LIMITATION ON SALE OF SUGARED BEVERAGES, AND SO FORTH. EXPANSION OF THE PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE HOSPITAL'S SERVICE AREA. CANCER (PREVENTION AND DETECTION) ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL HAS A CANCER COMMITTEE IN PLACE THAT IS DEDICATED TO CANCER PREVENTION AND EARLY DETECTION. IN 2014, SOME OF THE TACTICS INCLUDED CONNECTING PATIENTS AND FAMILIES TO 2-1-1 INFORMATION AND REFERRAL TO SOCIAL SERVICE RESOURCES, CONTINUING TO WORK WITH PATIENT NAVIGATORS TO IDENTIFY PATIENT NEEDS, AND HOSTING COMMUNITY LECTURES ON MULTIPLE TYPES OF CANCER TO ENCOURAGE CONVERSATIONS WITH HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS. GOOD SHEPHERD ALSO HAD COMMUNITY OUTREACH CAMPAIGNS ON COLON CANCER AWARENESS AND SCREENING, BREAST CANCER AWARENESS FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, AND E-CIGARETTES IN SCHOOLS. IN REGARDS TO COLON CANCER AWARENESS, LETTERS WERE SENT TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS REMINDING THEM TO GET THEIR BASELINE COLONOSCOPY AT AGE 50 AND NURSES ATTENDED COMMUNITY EXPOS FOR EDUCATION AND AWARENESS. IN ADDITION, MEETINGS WERE COORDINATED WITH AREA PHYSICIANS, BOTH GENERAL PRACTITIONERS AND SPECIALISTS, ABOUT PARTICIPATING IN SCREENING PROGRAMS AT THE HOSPITAL. E-CIGARETTE PREVENTION WAS ALSO ADDRESSED BY PARTNERING WITH AREA MIDDLE SCHOOLS AND HIGH SCHOOLS AND/OR ATTENDING COMMUNITY EVENTS WHERE THE TARGET AUDIENCE - YOUTHS - WERE PRESENT, NOT ONLY PROVIDING PREVENTION EDUCATION BUT ALSO TO CAPTURE FEEDBACK RELATED TO EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS. THERE WERE THREE OTHER IMPORTANT NEEDS THAT WERE NOT SELECTED AS PRIORITIES FOR NEW ACTIVITY BECAUSE THEY HAVE BEEN, AND CONTINUE TO BE ADDRESSED THROUGH EXISTING PROGRAMS OR PARTNERSHIPS. MENTAL HEALTH MENTAL HEALTH IS ADDRESSED BY MULTIPLE COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS THAT THE HOSPITAL SUPPORTS, SUCH AS SAMARITAN COUNSELING CENTER AND THE PIONEER CENTER FOR HUMAN SERVICES. THE HOSPITAL IS ALSO PROVIDING COMPLIMENTARY SPACE AT TWO ADVOCATE FACILITIES TO BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROVIDERS IN THE COMMUNITY. THE COMMUNITY HEALTH COUNCIL SET TARGETS FOR COLLABORATION AND INTEGRATION WITH COMMUNITY GROUPS TO HELP ADDRESS BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NEEDS. THE HEALTHIER BARRINGTON COALITION DEVELOPED A MENTAL HEALTH TASK FORCE TO HELP DETERMINE THE MOST PRESSING NEEDS AND HOW THE COMMUNITY MIGHT BETTER COLLABORATE TO MEET THOSE NEEDS. DIABETES/CHOLESTEROL/CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE WHEN GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL'S CHNA REVEALED THAT TYPE II DIABETES WAS CONTINUING TO INCREASE IN THE HOSPITAL'S COMMUNITY, THE HOSPITAL RESPONDED BY DEVELOPING AFFORDABLE DIABETES SCREENINGS. THESE SCREENINGS WERE OFFERED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY WITH THE INTENTION OF IDENTIFYING PEOPLE WHO UNKNOWINGLY HAVE PRE-DIABETES OR DIABETES, AND TO ENCOURAGE THEM TO ADOPT LIFESTYLE CHANGES THAT HELP THEM MANAGE THEIR CONDITION. BECAUSE THE HISPANIC POPULATION IS AT A GREATER RISK FOR TYPE II DIABETES, PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS ARE AVAILABLE IN SPANISH AND THE STAFF INCLUDES BILINGUAL CLINICIANS. IN 2014, DIABETES SCREENINGS WERE OFFERED QUARTERLY TO MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. NEARLY 72 PERCENT OF THOSE IDENTIFIED AS HIGH-RISK RETURNED FOR FOLLOW-UP CARE AND RE-TESTING. FOR HALF OF THESE INDIVIDUALS, THEIR A1C SCORES IMPROVED. MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENTS (TEEN) THE COUNCIL FELT THAT THE HOSPITAL IS ALREADY ADDRESSING THIS NEED BY BEING PART OF OPERATION CLICK. OPERATION CLICK IS A COMMUNITY PROGRAM THAT ADDRESSES THE RISK FOR YOUTH MOTOR VEHICLE FATALITIES. THE HOSPITAL HAS BEEN ACTIVE ON OPERATION CLICK'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS, PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS ANNUAL BANQUET AND RECENTLY PROVIDED FUNDING SO THE ORGANIZATION COULD HIRE A PART-TIME PROGRAM COORDINATOR FOR 24 MONTHS. THE SEED FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE COORDINATOR TO DEVELOP A FUNDING STREAM FOR SUSTAINMENT OF OPERATION CLICK IN THE FUTURE. OVERALL, OPERATION CLICK HAS BEEN IMPACTFUL AND HAS RESULTED IN IMPROVED SEAT BELT COMPLIANCE AS DOCUMENTED BY AN INCREASE IN AVERAGE COMPLIANCE RATES FROM 79% ON THE PRE-SURVEY TO 98% AS REPORTED BY PARTICIPANTS ON THE POST-PROGRAM SURVEY. NEEDS NOT SELECTED TO ADDRESS THERE WERE TWO REMAINING IMPORTANT NEEDS IDENTIFIED THAT THE HOSPITAL IS NOT ADDRESSING-DENTAL HEALTH AND BILINGUAL LITERACY. DENTAL HEALTH ADVOCATE GOOD SHEPHERD HOSPITAL DOES NOT HAVE ANY

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL
ExplntnTxt: HEALTH NEED SELECTED TO ADDRESS ASTHMA ASTHMA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY-RELATED DISEASES WITHIN SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL'S PSA WERE SELECTED AS THE TOP HEALTH NEED TO ADDRESS. AN EXAMINATION OF SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL'S INPATIENT ADMISSIONS AND EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT (ED) UTILIZATION DATA SHOWS THERE ARE A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS THAT SEEK SERVICES FOR ASTHMA/RESPIRATORY HEALTH ISSUES FROM THE HOSPITAL. IN FACT, PULMONARY ADMISSIONS WERE THE SECOND MOST PREVALENT TYPE OF INPATIENT ADMISSION AND THE EIGHTH MOST PREVALENT REASON FOR ED VISITS. THE SEVERITY AND PREVALENCE OF ASTHMA IS MOST EVIDENT IN LOW INCOME, MINORITY COMMUNITIES, AND THE DISPARITIES IN HOSPITALIZATION RATES FOR AFRICAN AMERICAN CHILDREN ARE STAGGERING, MAKING THIS A PROMINENT COMMUNITY HEALTH ISSUE. NATIONALLY, ASTHMA AFFECTS APPROXIMATELY 7.1 MILLION CHILDREN. THE DISEASE IS ONE OF THE LEADING CAUSES OF SCHOOL ABSENTEEISM - ACCOUNTING FOR MORE THAN 14 MILLION MISSED SCHOOL DAYS ANNUALLY (COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH, 2010). CHILDREN WITH ASTHMA MISS AN AVERAGE OF TWICE AS MANY SCHOOL DAYS AS OTHER CHILDREN (CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION). MISSED SCHOOL DAYS BY CHILDREN RESULT IN MISSED WORKED DAYS BY ADULTS - SO THERE ARE BOTH SIGNIFICANT FINANCIAL AND QUALITY OF LIFE IMPLICATIONS FOR CHILDREN WITH ASTHMA AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE BURDEN OF ASTHMA IN ILLINOIS MIRRORS NATIONAL TRENDS YET ILLINOIS HAS ONE OF THE HIGHEST ASTHMA MORTALITY AND MORBIDITY RATES IN THE NATION, AND IT CONTINUES TO INCREASE EACH YEAR (ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH, 2006). THE MAJORITY OF THE STATE'S ASTHMA DEATHS OCCUR IN COOK COUNTY (CHICAGO AND SUBURBAN COOK COUNTY), THE COUNTY IN WHICH SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL IS LOCATED. SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL HAS BOTH THE RESOURCES AND CAPACITY TO PARTNER WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ENGAGED IN ADDRESSING ASTHMA. HISTORICALLY, SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL HAS DEVELOPED COMMUNITY PROGRAMS IMPACTING ASTHMA. THE HOSPITAL IS CURRENTLY CONDUCTING OUTREACH ACTIVITIES AIMED AT SCHOOLS AND CHURCHES TO ADDRESS THIS DISEASE, INCLUDING THE MOST RECENT DEVELOPMENT OF THE KICKIN' ASTHMA PROGRAM, A SCHOOL-BASED CURRICULUM THAT ADDRESSES THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN AGES 11 TO 16 WITH ASTHMA. THE PROGRAM PROMOTES INDIVIDUAL RESPONSIBILITY, SELF-MANAGEMENT AND EARLY ACTION AMONG ADOLESCENTS. THE OVERALL GOAL OF KICKIN' ASTHMA IS TO IMPROVE ASTHMA MANAGEMENT AND DECREASE ACUTE CARE UTILIZATION AMONG CHILDREN AGES 11 TO 16. IN ADDITION TO THE SCHOOL-BASED CURRICULUM, CONTINUING MEDICAL EDUCATION FOR LOCAL SCHOOL NURSES, PEDIATRIC HEALTH FAIRS, SCHOOL PROGRAMS PROVIDING ASTHMA SCREENINGS, EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND PEAK FLOW METERS, AND ASTHMA RESOURCE PACKETS INCLUDING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND A RESOURCE DIRECTORY FOR LOCAL FAITH COMMUNITIES CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROGRAM'S EFFECTIVENESS AND HAVE HELPED TO LAY THE FOUNDATION FOR THE HOSPITAL'S EXPANSION OF INTERVENTIONS TO ADDRESS ASTHMA IN THE COMMUNITY. ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL DEVELOPED AN ASTHMA ACTION TASK FORCE TO ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING COMMUNITIES, GOALS AND OBJECTIVES: TARGET POPULATION: CHILDREN AGES 5-17 THAT RESIDE IN THE PRIMARY SERVICE AREA OF ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL (ASSH) WHICH INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING ZIP CODES: 60429 CALUMET CITY; 60411 CHICAGO HEIGHTS/FORD HEIGHTS; 60419 DOLTON; 60422 FLOSSMOOR; 60423 FRANKFORT; 60425 GLENWOOD; 60426 HARVEY; 60428 MARKHAM; 60429 HAZEL CREST; 60430 HOMEWOOD; 60438 LANSING; 60443 MATTESON; 60445 MIDLOTHIAN; 60452 OAK FOREST; 60461 OLYMPIA FIELDS; 60466 PARK FOREST; 60471 RICHTON PARK; AND 60473 SOUTH HOLLAND. GOAL: TO DECREASE ASTHMA RELATED EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT VISITS AND/OR HOSPITALIZATIONS OF CHILDREN AGES 5-17 THAT RESIDE WITHIN ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA BY DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING PROGRAMS TO INCREASE THE KNOWLEDGE BASE OF THE PEDIATRIC ASTHMA COMMUNITY TO INCLUDE ASTHMA MANAGEMENT SKILLS, TRIGGER IDENTIFICATION, AND THERAPEUTIC AND SOCIAL INTERVENTIONS THAT WILL REDUCE ASTHMA RELATED COMPLICATIONS WHILE ESTABLISHING SELF-ADVOCACY SKILLS AND ULTIMATELY CREATING A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THOSE THE HOSPITAL SERVES. OBJECTIVES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE: 1. ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL (ASSH) WILL INCREASE THE PROPORTION OF PEDIATRIC PERSONS WITH CURRENT ASTHMA WHO RECEIVE APPROPRIATE ASTHMA CARE ACCORDING TO NATIONAL ASTHMA EDUCATION AND PREVENTION PROGRAM (NAEPP) GUIDELINES WHILE AN INPATIENT OR DURING AN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT VISIT TO 100%. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: INITIATED AN EVIDENCE-BASED PEDIATRIC EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT ASTHMA TREATMENT ALGORITHM IN APRIL 2014. THE ALGORITHM PROVIDED ED STAFF GUIDANCE ON IDENTIFICATION, TREATMENT AND FOLLOW-UP CARE FOR A PEDIATRIC ASTHMA PATIENT. * APRIL 2014 - DECEMBER 2014: 25% OF ED PEDIATRIC PATIENTS WERE DISCHARGED HOME WITH AN ASTHMA ACTION PLAN AND 34% WERE DISCHARGED WITH FORMAL ASTHMA EDUCATION. 100% OF ED PEDIATRIC PATIENTS DISCHARGED FROM THE ED RECEIVED A POST-DISCHARGE WELLNESS CALL. CURRENTLY IN THE PROCESS OF COLLABORATING WITH ED CASE MANAGEMENT, ED PHYSICIANS, ED STAFF, AND RESPIRATORY THERAPY TO INITIATE DISCHARGE PLANNING IN THE ED AND A PROGRAM FOR FOLLOW UP BY A RESPIRATORY THERAPIST ON ALL PATIENTS DISCHARGED WITHOUT AN ACTION PLAN. * APRIL 2014 - DECEMBER 2014: 96% OF ELIGIBLE PEDIATRIC PATIENTS WITH A DIAGNOSIS OF ASTHMA IN THE ED WERE DISCHARGED HOME WITH STEROIDS. * APRIL 2014 - DECEMBER 2014: 94% OF PATIENTS WITH A PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS OF ASTHMA IN THE ED FILLED PRESCRIPTIONS AS IDENTIFIED ON POST-WELLNESS DISCHARGE CALL. THIS IS INDICATIVE OF THE APPROPRIATE USE OF THE ASTHMA ED TREATMENT PLAN AND DISCHARGE EDUCATION. * JANUARY 2014 - DECEMBER 2014: DECREASED THE NUMBER OF ED PEDIATRIC ASTHMA READMISSIONS FROM 43% IN 1ST QUARTER 2014 TO 18% YEAR END. 2. ADVOCATE SOUTH SUBURBAN HOSPITAL (ASSH) WILL PARTNER WITH THE COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE RESOURCES WITHIN 100% OF THE MIDDLE SCHOOLS AND DEVELOP 5 COMMUNITY COACHES WITHIN OUR PRIMARY SERVICE AREA WITH ASTHMA EDUCATION, INCLUDING HOW TO RECOGNIZE WORSENING ASTHMA, ADMINISTER QUICK-RELIEF MEDICATIONS, AND KNOW HOW AND WHEN TO CALL FOR EMERGENCY SERVICES TO CREATE SUPPORTIVE AND SAFE ENVIRONMENTS IN THE SCHOOL AND THE COMMUNITY BY 6/30/2015. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: GOAL: TRAIN 5 COMMUNITY PARTNERS ON ASTHMA TRIGGERS AND RESOURCES. * JUNE 2014 - MAY 2015: TRAINED 6 COMMUNITY PARTNERS INCLUDING: VICTORY APOSTOLIC CHURCH, MATTESON, ILLINOIS; ST. MARK MISSIONARY BAPTIST CHURCH, HARVEY, IL; SOUTHWOOD JR. HIGH SCHOOL, COUNTRY CLUB HILLS, ILLINOIS; HAZEL CREST SCHOOL DISTRICT 152;, HAZEL CREST PARK DISTRICT; AND BROOKWOOD JR. HIGH SCHOOL. * JUNE 2014 - SEPTEMBER 2014: ASSH NON-CLINICAL ASSOCIATE WAS TRAINED TO RECOGNIZE SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF ASTHMA AND TO ASSIST IN HEALTH FAIRS AND COMMUNITY EVENTS. - WHILE AT A COMMUNITY EVENT, AN ASTHMATIC THAT WAS HAVING DIFFICULTY MANAGING ASTHMA WAS RECOGNIZED BY THE NON-CLINICAL ASSOCIATE. THE CLINICAL ASSOCIATE WAS NOTIFIED AND ON THE SPOT EDUCATION WAS CONDUCTED ALONG WITH PROVIDING A SPACER AND REFERRAL INFORMATION. * JANUARY 2014 - SEPTEMBER 2014: 6 RESPIRATORY CARE PRACTITIONERS WERE TRAINED BY THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION TO IMPLEMENT THE KICKIN' ASTHMA PROGRAM. * JUNE 2014 - MAY 2015: COLLABORATED WITH HOMEWOOD FLOSSMOOR PARK DISTRICT AND HAZEL CREST PARK DISTRICT TO IDENTIFY A COMMUNITY PROGRAM EDUCATION PLAN. * HOMEWOOD FLOSSMOOR BASKETBALL PROGRAM ASTHMA EDUCATION IN PROGRESS. * HOMEWOOD FLOSSMOOR AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM ASTHMA EDUCATION IN PROGRESS. * HAZEL CREST YOUTH BASEBALL PROGRAM ASTHMA EDUCATION TO PARENTS. GOAL: PROVIDE 16 HOURS OF COMMUNITY TRAINING/MEETINGS. * JANUARY 2014 - SEPTEMBER 2014: PROVIDED 6 HOURS OF COMMUNITY EDUCATION. * FEBRUARY 2015 - HOSTED SCHOOL NURSE EDUCATION PROGRAM: IDENTIFIED A COMMUNITY PROGRAM THROUGH THE RESPIRATORY HEALTH ASSOCIATION THAT IS APPROVED BY THE ILLINOIS STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION FOR ONE CERTIFIED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT CREDIT (CPDU) FOR LICENSED SCHOOL TEACHERS. ASTHMA MANAGEMENT TARGETS CAREGIVERS AND PROVIDES EDUCATION ABOUT ASTHMA, SYMPTOM SEVERITY AND RECOGNITION, TRIGGERS AND AVOIDANCE, AND WHAT TO DO IN THE CASE OF AN ASTHMA EPISODE. THE 1-HOUR SESSION IS ADAPTED TO THE AUDIENCE WHICH CAN INCLUDE TEACHERS, NURSES, HEALTH AIDES, SCHOOL SUPPORT STAFF, PARENTS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS. 3. ASSH WILL IMPLEMENT A SCHOOL-BASED ASTHMA EDUCATION PROGRAM TO BE PROVIDED TO 80% OF THE MIDDLE SCHOOLS WITHIN OUR PRIMARY SERVICE AREA TO TARGET AS MANY CHILDREN WHO HAVE ASTHMA AS POSSIBLE, TO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THEM TO LEARN ASTHMA SELF-MANAGEMENT SKILLS AND TO HELP PROVIDE AN "ASTHMA-FRIENDLY" LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVE ASTHMA. ACCOMPLISHMENTS: GOAL: IMPLEMENT AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION EVIDENCE-BASED KICKIN' ASTHMA SCHOOL-BASED PROGRAMS. * JANUARY 2014 - SEPTEMBER 2014: 6 RESPIRATORY CARE PRACTITIONERS WERE TRAINED BY THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION TO IMPLEMENT THE KICKIN' ASTHMA PROGRAM. * IMPLEMENTED THE KICKIN' ASTHMA PROGRAM TO SCHOOLS WITHIN OUR PRIMARY SERVICE AREA INCLUDING: * 2013-2014
